The only downside is that the staff aren't very friendly & didnt even say "bye, safe journey etc...."! I'd definatly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Balmes,Mallorca Street,Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: UkAntonio
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a three night break in this hotel. Staff generally helpful and friendly,however upon arrival met by a stern and abrupt chap who did not really greet us in a friendly manner ,he didn't really do much for the PR of the hotel,having said that he was efficient and we booked in . Very clean although when you start looking you start seeing the odd broken tile and plastic ceiling fashia in bathroom cracked.Room an ok size,clean towels every day and beds made up.Lovely deep bath.Lollipops left for children,which was a nice touch. REALLY could done with tea/coffee facilities in room, that would have been good.There was a mini bar though. Air conditioning.Beds comfy and plenty of bedlinen if needed. One night arrived in bar and no one was serving.I approached reception after about 15 mins.A Spanish family then arrived and still no one serving,so I went again to reception and they called someone. I was waiting at bar and the bar attendant served the Spanish family first! That was the only negative item about our stay. Ate breakfast at a number of nearby cafes as some people said hotel was expensive. The cafes were really good and coffee excellent. Several people have said that the hotel is an ok distance to walk places.We walked many times to the central square to catch bus turistic at Placa Cataluyna.It was ok but after doing it a couple of times in the heat I would stay nearer to Las Ramblas next time. Swimming pool small but nice sitting areas around flanked by trees .Great to cool off in after a hot day in City.Outdoor bar by pool. Nice area.Barcelona lovely as had things for every age and interests. Magic Fountain was amazing and so was Sagrada Famillia,well worth a visit. Nothing awful really about hotel,it was a good and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “full price charged for sleeping on broken bed for 2 days”
Reviews.Author: SinemMertEge
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 days in this hotel, the first day was in an suite which was not very bad, the only complain was, it was not cleaned well, bathroom floor was full of hair. For the other 3 days we stayed in standart room. In the first night we could not sleep because of broken bed, in every move bed was shaking like an earthquake, in the morning we told the reception about the bed and they checked the room and agreed on the broken bed. The problem was there was not an available room for the second night so we had to sleep on the broken bed for the second time. Although I told them that I was pregnant and this bed hurt my back a lot, their approach was not friendly. When we were leaving the hotel, they fully charged the whole stay, I asked them if it is ethic to charge it fully, they said, the previous quest didnt compain about the bed. I felt like they were implying that it was our fault. That was really rude. We spent 10days in spain and already ready for hotel charges but it they would say, we can only make a %10 discount, we would think at least they showed an effort to fix our unsatisfaction. But they did not even care.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great for short stay”
Reviews.Author: agataa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Balmes Hotel for 3 nights in Feb 2008. Easy access by metro from the airport and then just a few minutes walk to the hotel via main street La Rambla full of all designed shops. Modern hotel, small rooms and very thin walls. Don't take room by the lift. Clean and simple. Nothing else needed if you planning to explore city during the day and sleep at night. Nice neighbourhood, plenty of small restaurants, tapas, coffee shops. Recommend to take a bus tour as you can go to many places. Very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with a pool and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: elanamig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, from June 23-June 27. We stayed in room 518. It is a corner room facing the internal courtyard. The room itself is on the smaller side, but definitely adequate. The bathroom was a nice size. PRO: - One double bed. It is common in Europe to get two single beds pushed together, and this hotel probably has rooms like this. But our particular room (518) had one double bed with a nice mattress. It was very comfortable. - Quiet. We paid 20EURO more per night to get a room facing the internal courtyard with a pool to guarantee peace and quiet during our stay, and it was more than delivered. The room was absolutely silent. We did not hear any sounds from our adjacent room, although we know that someone actually stayed there. - Pool. We have used the pool twice during our stay, and truly enjoyed it. It is not heated, but in June in Barcelona it does not need to be. We also enjoyed their two-level deck and the loungers. - Location. The hotel is located 2-4 blocks from the metro, depending on which line you need. The blocks are quite long, though. so the average (leisurely) walk to the metro was about 15 minutes. It was a little tiring in the evening, when our feet hurt after the day's sightseeing, but overall, it's not that big of a deal. The weather was nice, the area is nice, and we enjoyed the stroll, despite our aching feet. - English-speaking staff. We did not have any issues with the staff. They spoke reasonable English, answered our questions, and did not give us any trouble at all. CONS: - Construction in the area... That is our one and only complaint. We did not hear the noise because our room faced the courtyard, but for those whose room is facing the street - that might be an issue. Other than that, we had no problems. - We specifically requested (and paid about 20EURO per night more) for a room facing the courtyard with the pool to ensure peace and quiet during our stay, and

Reviews.Title: “A very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: semsat
Reviews.Content: The photos of this hotel are misleading - it looks stark and plain. We found it very artsy and stylish. The rooms are small but arranged very well. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The garden/pool area also do not show well in the photos but it is a lovely space. It is not right in the heart of the "action" but close enough and in a lovely neighborhood. We thought it was a great place to stay and very well-priced. Bonus: free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, but the service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: acctg
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the room as it was clean and modern - though plain and a bit sparse. The location was good to excellent and the little pool and hot tub were added bonuses. However, the front desk staff were disinterested, unhelpful and one could even be described as surly. We felt we were interupting them - even to pay our bill for our five nights stay (and they never even said "thank you"). Adding more frustration was that the internet (including free wi-fi in rooms) was down 3 out of 5 days we were there. Not surprisingly, the staff didn't seem to care one way or the other which only increased out annoyance with the place. Additional positives: We receieved an excellent rate by going to their website and clicking on the down button to see "other rates" - which normally would show higher rates, but at The Derby Hotels often show lower rates. and the rooms were air conditioned which turned out to be a blessing. So, the mixed reviews that show up at TA are, IMO, very accurate. I'd probably book elsewhere if I returned to BCN. Best thing about this hotel? Cerveceria Catalana is less than one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel70
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found this hotel as an emergency replacement for one we'd reserved prior to going to Europe. The first hotel had roaches and mold, so we were eager to find something clean and affordable. We took a cab from the roach motel up to Balmes and spoke to the front desk manager. He was very accommodating and even let us see a room. We came back the next morning and checked in for two nights. The room was two levels...you walk in and the bathroom is on your immediate left. A split staircase takes you up to the bedroom or down to the living room. It was odd that the bedroom was so small we could not keep our luggae in it. There was a queen-size bed and small night stand on either side. A wardrobe holding a TV was at the foot of the bed, with no room for suitcases. The living room was nice sized with another TV, desk, coffee table, chair and sofa. We could hear the TV of another room and people talking, but it wasn't terrible. The room was very clean. There are two computers in the lobby for all guests to share. It would have been nice to have had a fridge in the room. Overall, I would probably stay here again just to know it was clean. There is a fabulous tapas place just down the street, I think De Tapa Madre. The front desk guys were so nice, even xeroxing our travel guide pages for us so we didn't have to haul the whole book around.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - at all”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it is hard to really get your emotions going about a hotel. This one is like that. There's nothing special to report. Rooms are small, the aircon is noisy, and so is the street outside, but the location is fine and therefore comes the street noise. Breakfast is expensive (14€) - don't! In stead take a walk along C/ Mallorca to Cerveceria Catalana where you can get fresh orange juice, baguettes with ham, cheese or chorizo along with your coffee and authentic barcelonians on their way to work or just passing by. And it all for a fraction of the price of the hotel breakfast. Service is unattentive and seems like they don't really care - but they are friendly enough and answers any question you may have... just with that kind of ignorant look in their eyes. In general: this hotel just doesn't get under my skin. They didn't really care about us staying there, and I will probably have forgotten all about it soon... Zzzzzz ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: travellingkiwiLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Balmes was perfect for our 3 night stay in Barcelona. It's location was great - a short walk to Placa de Catalunya and then a stroll down La Rambla - so close to shops and restaurants and transport. Our taxi driver assured us it was a safe location as well - he said you could safely walk around there in the early hours. Our room was a good size double and was impeccably clean. There was no street noise as our room faced the courtyard but there was some internal hotel noise with doors shutting etc but no worse than many other places I've stayed in. The concierge staff all spoke English and were helpful when we asked any questions. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but it was just what we needed for our tourist weekend. If we'd wanted more time at the hotel and relaxing, probably would suggest an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Pool/Jacuzzi/Breakfast/Cleanliness/Staff - great, Air-con was a bit noisy, The Rambla - 25 mins walk away”
Reviews.Author: HarryHillNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Balmes. We paid around £35 pppn B&B and the breakfast was rather nice, although make sure to ask for eggs and bacon as it`s not on offer unless you request it each morning when you arrive in the restaurant, there`s no extra charge. The rooms are very clean and the beds were confortable, although the airconditioning was quite noisy...............not good for a light sleeper. I was quite warm at night and I received quite a few moscitoe bites. The pool was not warm enough to swim in but the sun loungers and the Jacuzzi was a real bonus.......................it must be great in the Summer. The internet in reception is also free of charge..................this is a decent place for the price and it`s 3* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keels71
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights @ The Balmes in December for my husbands 40th Birthday. I also had booked the hotel a few months earlier, but nearer the time time checked the price and it had gone down,so I phoned the hotel who said that they would honour the cheaper price. The rooms are small but fine, the bathroom is compact and clean, but have to say the bath is tiny. I thought Barcelona was the most wonderful place I have ever been to, the building's, the food, the wine. We found Barcelona very reasonable for food and drinks, although the Ramblas is a rip off!!!!... Planning on going again probably March or April.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: I would like to have given this hotel 3.5 as we did have some problems (heating) but seeing that I can't I decided to give 4! The hotel is very well located - 5 mins walk to the Passeig de Gracia and about a 10 minute walk to Placa de Catalunya. There are several excellent, reasonably priced restaurants and bars within close proximity to the hotel and the shopping is great. We booked a standard room a few months ago via the hotel's website. However, just before we left the UK I checked the website and noted that the price of the room was now e70 instead of the e80 we had been quoted. I contacted the hotel and who advised me that we would be charged the new rate. On arrival the guy on reception advised us that we were being upgraded as the hotel was not full. We were also offered 2 for 1 on the breakfast - usually e14 each. We decided to accept this offer given that it would probably have cost us nearly that for coffee and croissants in a local cafe. The breakfast, which was very good, consisted of a cold buffet - fresh fruit, cheese, meats, cereals, yoghurts, bread and cakes. In addition you could have eggs and bacon. Whilst good value for e7 each I would not have paid e14 each. Our room, which was simply but tastefully decorated, faced onto the back and we did not, therefore, get any road noise. However, as meantioned by other reviewers, you do get noise. Whilst the rooms are supposedly soundproofed you can hear the plumbing, doors closing etc from other rooms. Despite being a light sleeper it didn't really affect me to much - I guess it may have been that the hotel was not busy. On our first night the heating did not work (and the room was freezing) but it was sorted straight away once we reported it. Another night we came back to find the electrics in the room had gone - again sorted quickly. We found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful with reasonable English. Whilst being January and unexceptionally cold for Barcelona we did not use the pool. However I think that it woud be a bonus in the summer plus having space to lie in the sun after a hard days sightseeing/shopping. Whilst I would stay in this hotel again I have stayed in others in the same location which were equally as good and similarly priced so would depend on what offer I could get. We stayed in the Barcelona Center last year (opposite the Balmes) which I think spoiled us. I would like to recommend the Dry Martini Bar (recommended in several guide books) for an experience - worth going but the martinis start at e9!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best ;0(”
Reviews.Author: rollerchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business as the rate seemed quite good. Not sure if I was unlucky with my room (as it was an internal room), but I found it quite dingy, musty and a little pokey. The bathroom was fully equipped but left a little to be desired - the daily fight with the shower curtain for one! It is also quite noisy as the corridors seem to echo when people move about. (Recommend ear plugs!). Pool looked nice, but I arrived too late in the eve to use it. Free entrance to the Egyptian museum for guests too, which I used. (Not much there, but something to do if you have an hour to kill!) . Overall, not my first choice of hotel, but If you can get a good price though, I would consider it again overall.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: helbag
Reviews.Content: most importantly, the location is spot on- around 15 minutes walk down to Placa de Catalunya. if you enjoy shopping, you are only five minutes away from the main shopping street Passeig de Gracia. Everything was easy to get to- especially Gaudi buildings (la Pedrera) pool was great for a dip after a long day of sightseeing- rooms were very very clean- we even had a small terrace with chairs and a table my friend and i don't speak spanish- the hotel staff that we dealt with spoke good enough english for this not to be a problem- however some of the staff could have been more friendly- e.g. saying hola when we went out or returned in the evening. overall, i would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to make the most out of their trip to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - grumpy staff”
Reviews.Author: Family2YoungAdulKids
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying the hotel is fine. We took advice from this site and booked rooms facing the courtyard (paid 20 Euros extra per night per room) and it was incredibly quiet. We liked the hotel's location and access to dining spots. The small pool was very pleasant. The staff was very grumpy and did nothing to make us feel welcomed. Personally, I think all but one of the staff we met should be fired. There should be a reason that hotels are considered to be part of the hospitality industry. I think if I checked in again I would immediately make it known that I was not going to tolerate the unpleasantness of the staff. Additionally we wanted to change something on our reservation. This was impossible to do via email or phone calls we made before we left the United Sates. We wound up keeping the reservation as we originally booked but we did feel scammed. All this being said, I still would stay there again. We found the rooms to be perfectly cleaned and maintained. One final tip, we wandered over to the "Passeig Gràcia" a beautiful boulevard about three blocks from the hotel. We had a quick breakfast of coffee and pastries at a cafe .... it turned out to be a $75 breakfast for four of us. My guess is this is just emblematic of the priciness of this particularly elegant thoroughfare - cafes off on side streets charged a fraction of this cost.

Reviews.Title: “No double rooms on standard rates”
Reviews.Author: Annabel53
Reviews.Content: Having booked a double room through expedia we were then told on arrival that in order to get a double we needed to pay a supplement but that it would be very quiet, until they knocked down a wall outside our window at 8am. Following my complaint about that the staff were grumpy and rude. I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stained sheets, rude manager”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust219
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, but there were several issues that ruined the experience for me. First of all, if you are not fluent in Spanish, this is NOT the hotel for you. The staff seemed very annoyed to have to speak English with us. I understand that we're in their country, so why should they have to speak our language? But it is a hotel, it happens. Every hotel guest we encountered was British (and spoke English with the staff), so this isn't an uncommon occurence for them. Secondly, my bedsheets and pillowcases were covered in brown stains. It was quite gross. And last but not least...the airline lost our luggage, and our cell phones did not work overseas. The manager seemed very annoyed that we gave the airlines the hotel's phone number as our contact number. When we asked simple questions about the airport, we were given short, gruff answers that were far from helpful. Where is the service here? it wasn't a cheap hotel, they could at least pretend to be understanding of our situation. Needless to say, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Phaed0
Reviews.Content: Hotel Balmes was one of four places we stayed during our recent visit to Spain and it was also one of the best values. The downtown location is near Casa Mila, Casa Batllo and the Gracia Metro station. We very much appreciated the free WiFi. But there were some issues: 1. The heat/AC seemed to furnish only heat, with no thermostat, and when we threw open the window to relieve the stuffiness, there was a constantly noisy street scene outside. 2. There was a loud dripping noise at times on the ceiling of the bathroom, 3. The bath/shower is designed in such a way that the bath spout protrudes into the center of the tub, making it an easy target for your knee when showering, 4. The room was a bit on the shabby side and in need of some minimal decoration, such as pictures on the walls, 5. Some of the desk staff seemed a bit arrogant and unaccommodating. My wife stayed at the Balmes three years ago and had a better experience. We might stay here again if subsequent reviews on TripAdvisor indicate that the problems have been resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located- Staff Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: RonniD
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel based on location- and in that sense it was perfect. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel front desk staff however were totally rude and unhelpful. My friend lost his luggage and they were not even willing to make the call to the airport to help him find out the status. It was easy enough to find wonderful things to see and do in the area- but no thanks to the hotel staff. I would recommend it as a excellent place if you have a short time to see Barcelona and want to be in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: GrannyFloe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week this Easter and found the hotel staff to be pleasant and helpful. We would not recommend the inside rooms as they are overheated and small. After our first night we transferred to a room at the back which was more spacious and had a lovely view of the garden. The bathroom was well-appointed and a pleasure to use. We enjoyed the breakfast, but it is rather pricey. A better bet is the nearby Cervesseria Catalana. Just as good and a quarter the price. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - what is there to criticise?”
Reviews.Author: SuzyandMicky
Reviews.Content: I don't know how anyone can knock this hotel. The public areas are smart and stylish, the rooms well equipped, very clean, nicely decorated (we had a lovely bathroom) and a comfortable size. There was also free internet access in the swish foyer! The staff pleasant, efficient and professional- all one should expect really: they are not there to be your friend! In terms of noise, we had had a room on a lower floor above the entrance and yes we could hear traffic when we had the window open but when it was shut, it was barely audible apart from the odd siren (quieter than my London flat anyway!). We were disturbed by another guest outside our room on her mobile but a hotel is not accountable for its guests and it is a hotel not a library after all. I would not describe it as noisy. The best bit though was definitely the breakfast - fantastic choice of food from the buffet such as cold meats, pastries, cereals etc (none of it rationed) as well as freshly cooked dishes (first time I have seen real bacon served by a continental hotel!). It is also served in a very nice conservatory style room. This hotel seems to have its detractors - I can only think they want a 5* hotel at 3* prices. This is definitely the best 3* hotel I have stayed in that I can think of. You can certainly do a lot worse for your money. Recommended!!
